snippet: For years Sandy Lewis has railed against Wall Street’s deceit. But vindication isn’t sweet.
abstract: Sandy Lewis, an ex-stock broker and outspoken critic of Wall Street, lives a life of self-imposed exile on his farm in Essex, NY; Lewis was barred from the trade after pleading guilty to stock manipulation in 1989, an act he says he committed to make a point and highlight the system's inadequacies; some view Lewis as eccentric while others take heed of his ability to detect patterns and anticipate market troubles.

byline.original: By MICHAEL POWELL and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: For years Sandy Lewis has railed against Wall Street’s deceit. But vindication isn’t sweet.

headline.seo: The Lonely Redemption of Sandy Lewis, Wall Street Provocateur
